title: 67: Tim Said, Man
description: We'll be guests on the WWDC live episode of The Talk Show: Tuesday, June 3, 6‚Äì9 PM. Get tickets here ASAP! John will be taking a plane... for you. Follow-up: Which is faster: installing Showbot or reimplementing it? Casey's open-source Node version PHP isn't faster than Javascript, voiding Marco's accidental argument in the last episode. Node.js uses CommonJS, not AMD. ECMAScript also adds formal module support, which es6-module-transpiler lets you use today. To the great surprise of nobody except John, iPhones come with earbuds, and those earbuds come with clickers. To the great surprise of nobody, including John, the Bluetooth-pairing interface in a car was terrible, and both Marco and Casey missed an obscure reference. iOS games that support physical game controllers must also work without them. If the "iPhone 6" comes in two sizes, which do you buy? Possibility of resolution scaling modes. Would the cameras be different? (Marco on The Talk Show, starting around 01:26:00). WWDC product-announcement predictions: New MacBook Airs or a 12" Retina MacBook Air? (Intel's Broadwell delay) Macworld's slow SSD speeds in the new Airs may just be from different SSD manufacturers. Then, what are the terms of SBF's bail? Just how much internet access can that man have? Finally, we're talking a rambly and non-spoilery review of John Wick 4, a movie that doesn't feel almost three hours long.

Then, it‚Äôs sadly time to bid goodbye to DPReview, the beloved camera website. Meanwhile, we never even got to say hello to Tax Heaven 3000, a dating sim/tax filing software that Steam yanked unceremoniously this week ‚Äî or did they?

description: Tonight‚Äôs special guest is The Verge‚Äôs senior writer Elizabeth Lopatto, to discuss what else but: THE COLLAPSE OF SILICON VALLEY BANK. She‚Äôs a pragmatic, expert voice to walk all of us through a confusing and dramatic weekend, and she knows what we should be keeping an eye on next. Then, Brianna and Simone discuss the existence of the moon, and Scream 6!

title: 428: AI Everywhere All At Once
description: Simone is back but still dying of Italian respiratory diseases. Still, we‚Äôre in for a high-energy show! Let‚Äôs talk about Google‚Äôs forays into AI ‚Äî are they behind Microsoft, or will their years of research put them out ahead in the end? Then, a Spotify redesign threatens to make the app more visually similar to TikTok. Is Spotify doing something smart or overextending itself? Finally, Christina explains one of the biggest financial scams in recent memory.

description: This week on Rocket, Simone kissed too many Italians, so Brianna and Christina are running amok. They talk about the new ChatGPT API and the potential it could have on different startups and industries, the risky bets Binance made with its customer‚Äôs money (without telling them) and Elizabeth Holmes‚Äô latest attempt to get out of jail, thus saving Christina $500.

description: This week on Rocket, Simone is in Italy, so Brianna and Christina are joined by special guest Alex Cranz! They discuss some important technology cases in front of the Supreme Court, Meta‚Äôs new plan for verified Facebook and Instagram accounts, and finally wrap things up with some delicious dirt about the most successful show on TV that you don‚Äôt watch, but your parents definitely do, Yellowstone.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 425: Word of the Day: Engagement
description: This week on Rocket, the word of the day is ENGAGEMENT! Elon Musk has ordered Twitter engineers to boost engagement of his own Tweets. So that‚Äôs normal! Meanwhile, how are things going over on Mastodon? There‚Äôs some kerfuffle in the tech world over growth on the platform(s). Brianna and Christina discuss their own experience with the decentralized social network. Finally, Marcin Wichery joins us to discuss his history of keyboards, Shift Happens!

title: 424: When Cars Hover Gently
description: Microsoft and Google have got it and they‚Äôre flaunting it. It being AI-POWERED SEARCH. How‚Äôs is going, and what are the benefits and concerns? Then, a Right to Repair bill has passed in New York State ‚Äî but by the time it was signed it had been somewhat defanged by corporate lobbyists. What does it mean for Right to Repair more broadly? For dessert we have Jason Torchinsky and Matt Hardigree of The Autopian calling in to tell us about the hot new independent automotive news site ‚Äî and illegal engines.

title: 423: We're Not Lawyers
description: Tesla is coming under fire for misleading customers with its self-driving promises. Does the case hold any water, and what are the consequences if Tesla is found guilty? Plus, deepfake pornography could (and SHOULD!) be taken to the courtroom as well. Finally ‚Äî what are Netflix's proposed password sharing rules anyway?

title: 422: Third-Party Rocket
description: Longtime Twitter users are cast into mourning as Twitter cuts off API access for third-party clients. Many of those apps are beloved by Twitter's power users and built the site that we know and love ‚Äî love? Is that the right word? ‚Äî today. Then, furor online over the reveal that CNET has long been using AI to write select financial articles, and that over half those articles had factual errors. How does something like this happen? Finally, two of Rocket's favorite scamsters are making big comebacks.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 421: Christina in Russian

The Mac Mini is also here, and Christina has a very compelling case for its existence. Meanwhile, Logan Paul has apologized to a popular YouTuber for calling him a liar and a criminal! But it's not all good news for his CryptoZoo‚Ä¶ schemes. For dessert, a Forbes 30 Under 30 alum takes on JP Morgan Chase. And not in a good way.

title: 420: Make Transportation Sexy Again
description: The FAA has had a massive outage, and there are rumors about a design change that would make MacBooks ‚Äî and maybe iMacs? ‚Äî incredibly exciting. Plus, what's up with Logan Paul's second alleged crypto pump-and-dump? SERIOUSLY?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 419: BEST and WORST of 2022!
description: We're all BACK on the hot mic and talking about our best and worst scams, products, and purchases of 2022. Who still has a LastPass subscription? Who believes in FTX? Who loves to throw money down the Apple well? You'll find it all out here, in the awards show that has, possibly, our MOST unanimous nominations EVER.

That's right, this week, you'll be finding out how right (or wrong) we were about the Musk acquisition of Twitter by revisiting previous predictions. Plus, we revisit our exclusive interview with Bug from Spooky Games. Because Brianna will not rest until you buy Halloween too.

description: SBF has been indicted so we're ranking him on our tier list of people who should face repercussions for their actions (S-tier). Then, an EU act threatens to require Apple to allow sideloading apps on iOS. Who stands to benefit, and who stands to suffer? Finally, Brianna and Simone discuss their favorite games of the year.

Rumors have gone around for years that Ubisoft's Notre Dame from Assassin's Creed Unity could help restore the real cathedral after the 2019 fire. Simone has devoted some time to debunking that. What about Brianna's long-awaited iPad Mini update? And will anyone, anyone at all be getting a new iPhone this year? Then, in our second story, Apple has patched the flaw that allowed the Pegasus exploit to get access to users' phones, and in our dessert, Nicki Minaj's cousin's friend's testicles. Yeah. author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 350: Many Apples
description: Many many tiny slices of Apple are coming to you, listener. First, an update on Apple's CSAM tools and concessions to the anti-trust critics! But will it be enough to save the App Store? Next, we have an upcoming Apple event, so tradition calls for us to discuss what we are expecting. But what we weren't expected was Apple's car guy Doug Field leaving for Ford!! Is he so excited to have a product that finally launches? Maybe! All this and more on Rocket.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 349: Arriving Today!
description: This week on Rocket, tech journalist and author Christopher Mims is here to discuss his new book, Arriving Today. It's the book that critics are saying "makes supply chains interesting" (Simone de Rochefort, 2021) ‚Äî and guess what he does during this interview? He makes supply chains interesting!! You have to listen to believe it and then you will immediately want to read his book. Then, Google and Apple are being hit with a new law in South Korea, and Elizabeth Holmes is finally going to trial. That is, if they can ever find a jury of her peers.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 348: Only Fans, Only Problems
description: But where are the only solutions? This week on Rocket we're talking about the Only Fans debacle, which came to a tenuous resolution mere hours before we started recording? Reverse Rocket Rule! Then, it's a deep dive into the Mystery of the Exploding PSUs from Gigabyte. Would you give up your hard-won GPU to save yourself from an exploding power supply unit? And finally: hey, new Spider-Man! That's an episode of Rocket.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 347: YAK, BACK, DO IT AGAIN
description: WHEELS TURNING ROUND AND ROUND. This week we're talking about, yes, YIKYAK, the zombie social media platform where you can post hyper-local bullying for all the local elder millennials to enjoy. Then, Google joins Samsung and Apple in not shipping chargers with its new phones! This is ALL APPLE'S FAULT. Meanwhile, Intel is trying it with new gamer-focused Arc-brand GPUs that have cool code names like "Battlemage" and "Celestial" and honestly those should just be their real names. Finally, dessert this week is an episode from Wall Street Journal on the tech workers who are taking on not one, but TWO full-time jobs‚Ä¶ and getting away with it.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 346: Really Ridiculous Content
description: Apple proposes to add controversial machine learning tools to the iPhone to protect children ‚Äî but is it the right thing to do? Also, hey, new iPhone rumors! Apparently, no amount of questionable activity will prevent us from being consumers in this capitalist hellscape.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 345: Scholastic Succession
description: On this episode of Rocket, we're not saying anyone was murdered! We're just not. But we ARE saying the RIAA's ridiculous bullying could MURDER the music industry and their penny-pinching ways won't help creators!! In better news, the OLED Nintendo Switch is looking GOOD and UH-OH‚Ä¶ WE WANT IT!!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 344: Viral News
description: This week we're discussing the lawsuit against Activision Blizzard and employee walk-outs protesting widespread sexual harassment at the company. Also, mandatory vaccines at Google, and Adam Driver turning into a centaur.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 343: Faith in Ted Sarandos
description: It's a big week for Rocket Rules: Last week Steam announced its Steam Deck handheld PC, and Netflix announced it was getting into games! But in the middle of all that fun, don't we have time for‚Ä¶ some Apple Rumors? You know we do! We always do...
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 342: Goodbye, Fleets
description: The New York Times has a killer new story on Facebook's relationship with CrowdTangle. And then, speaking of driving engagement, Twitter is killing Fleets? WHAT ARE WE GONNA DO!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 341: Social Media Astir
description: Christina and Simone are tackling the newest model of the Nintendo Switch with its fancy new OLED screen. Is it the Switch we've been waiting for!? Maybe not!? Is it the Switch we have? Yes. And then, social media companies are facing consequences abroad, while Section 230 is under attack in the United States.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 340: Breaking Windows
description: This week Christina and Bri are talking about Windows 11, the various events from the launch and they detour into the state of Windows in general. For dessert, Bri and Christina extol the virtues of F9 and the Fast and Furious franchise.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 339: Snap Swears
description: This week we're hitting the road again with Peloton ‚Äî any paying the price!? Peloton's PR problems are not getting better, with a new update soft-locking their treadmills for non-subscribers. And then, a Supreme Court Snap swears settlement! In a very alliterative episode of Rocket.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 338: Hype House!!
description: We have special guest Ashley Carman of The Verge on the show to talk about her INCREDIBLE story about the rise and fall of HiStudios and the podcast hype house that collapsed dramatically over the last year. And then we talk about E3 and all the good games!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 337: MoviePass: Back in the News
description: It‚Äôs another WWDC with Rocket. We‚Äôre chatting about the coffers announcements from Apple‚Äôs keynote, and giving yet another dramatic update on MoviePass. What could possibly have happened now?!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 336: Cheaters Prosper
description: Aunt Christina is having baby-time, but she's still here because we absolutely can't talk about GPUs and Stack Overflow without her! Nvidia has released an updated 3080, the RTX 3080 Ti. But it's $500 more than last year's card? What is HAPPENING? Then, speaking of large numbers, Prosus has acquired Stack Overflow for 1.8 billion, with a B. Is this a yikes or a yay?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 335: AIRBN-BS
description: Christina is at Microsoft Build this week, but what's this?? HOOFBEATS ON THE HORIZON? BRIANNA WU IS RETURNED FROM FLORIDA and she's SO ready to talk about the remastered Mass Effect trilogy. But first, we talk about Valve's new Switch-like CP and AirBnB's whole deal.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 334: Apple is Killing Games
description: Christina and Simone are mourning Christina's Dogecoin dreams. But wait, what's this?? Apple is doing one good thing and two weird ones!? Unprecedented behavior from our problematic fave. Find out what's up on Rocket!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 333: Apple vs. Epic: Puritanical Edition
description: This week Simone and Christina are interrogating Apple vs. Epic! Would you download an unspeakable game‚Ä¶ to your phone?? Would you?? We'll answer that and more as we examine Apple's puritanical behavior in the courtroom, and then pivot to the crummy future of smart toasters and their ilk, as the chip shortage persists.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 332: All Out With Baby Stuff
description: In a lightning-fast episode we're talking about‚Ä¶ yep, the big Basecamp blow-up, and we've got a lot to say. Then finally, Apple vs. Epic is finally before a judge, and lots of fun secrets are coming out!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 331: Triple Scamtown
description: It's triple helping of scams this week on Rocket. First off, a binary options scam comes to light after years of fleecing vulnerable people. Then, the secret behind McDonalds' ice cream machine failures is finally revealed!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 330: Peloton Problems
description: This week we're discussing Peloton's clash with the CPSC, and then, it's time to discuss all the products from Apple's Spring Forward event. New iMacs, a purple iPhone, and more!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 329: Unlocking iPhones
description: Catching up on the big unanswered questions‚Ä¶ however did the FBI get into the phone in the San Bernadino case? All that and more on this week's Rocket!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 328: Works of Art
description: Bri and Simone tackle many works of art: is coding art? What about Mario? And finally, a banger scamtown that you don't want to miss.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 327: All of the Lights
description: In a ROWDY show, we talk about what we'd like to see from WWDC, and what all the Amazon execs are getting up to on Twitter!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 326: Slack Slips Up
description: Let's have some big bites of tech news? Slack is messing up, Apple is Facing Consequences for its butterfly keyboard missteps, and Amazon is trying game development, again.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 325: Meat in Dongletown
description: We have a PACKED SHOW THIS WEEK, discussing new updates in the NFT world, the sentencing of a notorious Twitter hacker and a shortage of chips that could impact fall phone launches!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 324: Abolish It!
description: This week on Rocket it's a Sonos speaker announcement, a new color e-ink tablet review, and ‚Ä¶ Meghan and Harry's Oprah interview.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 323: Psyched About Mesh
description: This week we're talking about NFTs and crypto art! What's up with THAT? Are you ready to unleash the SALT?? Then, it's an update on Bri's supercomputer, which is currently taking over the Eastern seaboard. Can she be stopped!?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 322: Net Neutrality Revivified
description: This week we're reviewing some rumors about the iPhone 13 and discussing a California judge's decision to allow that state's net neutrality law to be enforced.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 321: GameStop Consequences
description: This week we had the first full Nintendo Direct we've had in ages! Plus, this week's big tech news: Apple versus Epic continues, and the fallout of GameStock's wild stock week(s) is here.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 320: Clubhouse Clones
description: This week Christina and Simone discuss Bloomberg's massive profile on Tim Cook, as well as the Clubhouse clones that are about to hit the social media universe. Can Facebook and Twitter live up to Clubhouse's success? Then Christina finally gets to vent some of her feelings on the latest coverage of Britney Spears.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 319: Stonks, Part 2
description: This week on Rocket we're following up on the GameStop stock situation, and discussing financial apps. Then, Jeff Bezos is stepping down as CEO of Amazon! Finally, everyone is roused by a tall woman in Resident Evil VIII's demo.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 318: GAMESTONK
description: In another one of "those episodes," your hosts discuss the GameStop stock shenanigans that definitely aren't going to backfire on anyone at all. Then, it's time to walk ‚Äî did you know? Apple is releasing an audio experience for Apple Fitness + and it's all about celebrities, and walking. Finally, GODZILLA VS. KONG.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 317: Electrical Systems!
description: We're sounding the ALLEGED APPLE RUMORS KLAXON once again! And this new Macbook spoiler is maybe the most exciting one we've ever heard. Then Christina reviews her new e-ink reader, and Bri rewires a whole Porsche.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 316: Guess Who's Back
description: This week we give updates on the Parler situation, and Christina's long-awaited AirPods Max review! And in exciting news: It's CES week, and this might be our favorite CES ever! Finally, our most-demanded update in Rocket history for dessert. Yep‚Ä¶ it's the Cellmate hack.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 315: Trump‚Äôs Twitter Ban
description: In this special bonus episode, we discuss some extremely fresh news: Trump's Twitter account has been suspended and Apple is considering taking the app where the Wednesday's coup was planned off of the App Store. Who thinks that's a good idea?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 314: Yet Another Normal Episode
description: On yet another chill week in the United States, Brianna and Simone talk about liquid shaders in Half-Life: Alyx and the new union for Google employees!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 313: Best and Worst Tech of 2020
description: It's time for the best and worst of 2020! With so many wonderful and disastrous stories to choose from, what could we possibly agree on?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 312: Perpetual Nightmare
description: Time to talk about two ongoing nightmares: a massive hack that implicates many government agencies, and the release of Cyberpunk 2077.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 311: Leadership!
description: Discussing all the bad choices that CD Projekt Red and Apple leadership have made this year I guess! Also, Taylor Swift released a new album of bangers.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 310: AirBra Max
description: Christina bought the Airpods Max. We're very sorry. Also, the FTC is suing Facebook so we fight about it.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 309: Scooting to the Couch
description: Brianna is back and recovering like a boss from knee surgery and she and Christina talk about macOS Big Sur, the Salesforce Slack Acquisition and then talk about the best/worst grift we‚Äôve seen for someone to try to scam a Mac Pro.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 308: We Salute the Algorithm
description: Simone dishes on her love affair with her new iPad Air. Also, Snapchat is taking a bite out of TikTok's gameplan with Snapchat Spotlight, but will it be a success? Also: Apple's Head of Security and a bribery case we did not see coming.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 307: Lamb Biryani (Shot on iPhone)
description: Special guest Henry T. Casey comes on the show to give us his hands-on impressions of the MacBook Air with the new M1 chip! Things look...dare we say‚Ä¶ promising? We also went hands-on with the PlayStation 5, and chat about‚Ä¶ Fleets!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 306: Not Political!
description: This week we're discussing Apple's ONE MORE THING event and the advent of ARM-based chips in the MacBook Air, Macbook Pro, and Mac Mini. Will they live up to the hype? Then, Bri's first-hand experience with the Xbox Series X, and Assassin's Creed Valhalla.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 305: Who Cares!
description: This week Christina and Simone are UNCHAINED and talking about how the different social media platforms handled this election! There are some winners and losers ‚Äî but none so far in this election, because we recorded this on Wednesday night! But first, a divergence into Netflix's terrible adaptation of Rebecca.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 304: Chips' Challenge
description: The PlayStation 5 review units are out, forcing many to ask ‚Äî how big is too big? And then AMD has gone and purchased Xilinx! What does it mean for the future of chips? Finally, an update on our two favorite scammers, Anna Delvey and Billy McFarland.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 303: Well, This is a Fun One
description: This week on Rocket we're eating dessert first, and talking about Jeffrey Toobin's Zoom scandal. Then, it's the first batch of iPhone reviews! Featuring Simone actually, maybe, sort of, buying a new phone on the show. Finally, the DOJ is actually pursuing an antitrust suit against Google. What will come of it?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 302: Donut Shaped Magnets with Rene Ritchie
description: Simone abandoned us this week, so Christina and Bri are joined by Rene Ritchie, Apple analyst/YouTuber-extraordinaire to break down the Apple iPhone 12 event. Also, a favorite character from Rocket‚Äôs past gets some news.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 301: Chastity Cage Hackers
description: Apple is on the verge of another media event, and the PS5 has been torn down. Then, the ultimate example of technology lock-in.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 300: Dessert
description: To celebrate episode 300 we bring on some special guests from the Relay FM family, and taste test Brach's god-awful Thanksgiving Dinner candy corn.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 299: Pre-Order Season
description: Xbox pre-orders opened up this week‚Ä¶ did they go better than the pre-orders for the PlayStation 5 did? NO! Then, it's what's happening with TikTok in the exact moment we recorded this episode, which will not doubt have changed completely by the time you listen to it. Oh, and Microsoft acquired Bethesda. Cool!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 298: PlayStation 5 TikTok Arm Nvidia Apple
description: In a super-size show, we cover every big announcement from the last week and a half: PlayStation 5 details, an Apple Event (no new phones yet though), the TikTok deal with Oracle and the Nvidia deal with Arm. Phew. Tune in for everything, and some things you never asked for!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 297: 30 Year-Old Golden Girl
description: Today on Rocket, we update you on the latest episode of our favorite soap opera, Apple Vs Epic, and then on a bunch of video game stuff! The Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S are coming out soon(ish), and Nintendo has loads of plans to celebrate Super Mario Bros. 35th anniversary.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 296: The Godfather
description: Folding phones are back for round two: this time it's Samsung's Z Fold 2 and Microsoft's Surface Duo. Then, Mike Piontek, the creator of the app Deliveries, pops in to talk about why they went with a subscription model.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 295: Supreme Court AU
description: The next episode of our favorite soap opera, Epic vs. Apple, is HERE! Followed by a look back at TikTok's momentous second year and latest lawsuit against the U.S. government.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 294: Apple Bluster
description: The dramatic saga of Epic vs. Apple continues, with all the updates since our emergency episode last week and a Hefty discussion of the importance of Unreal Engine. Then, author Lauren Beukes joins us to discuss her latest book, Afterland.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 293: Emergency Epic Cast
description: In a Rocket first, late-breaking news was so Rocket worthy, we had to record a bonus episode.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 292: Sick of the Slab
description: Microsoft declares war on Simone by launching a "sexy" phone, and Uber and Lyft are forced to appeal a California judge's decision. Plus, did Christina unbox her gamer chair?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 291: Big Decisions
description: There are NEW MACS and a lot of government-type developments in the world of tech. TikTok is potentially being bought by Microsoft and Christina has NO COMMMENT, and also a post-mortem of last week's antitrust hearings. Finally, we've tried Raycons!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 290: Adrienne Lawrence and Olivia Solon
description: Today on Rocket we have two special guests! First up, Adrienne Lawrence tells us about her vital book, Staying In The Game. Then Olivia Solon is on to tell us about her latest story for NBC about Instagram‚Äôs algorithmic moderation unfairly affecting users perceived to be Black. Tune in!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 289: Henry Cavill Builds His Own Gaming PC
description: A big update on Twitter's disastrous hack AND new chips from AMD? We're so spoiled. Plus, find out what headphones Simone got!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 288: Bluecheck Blues
description: Well, Twitter is exploding this week, with many high-profile accounts hacked in a bitcoin scam. Meanwhile, TikTok is being vaguely menaced by corporations and governments the world over. And finally, video games?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 287: Misinformation!!
description: We have Nina Jancowicz, the author of a book on misinformation campaigns, talking about how the United States can save itself! Then, the Clubhouse meltdown, you knew we had to cover it. Finally, the case for Eurovision Song Contest: The Story of Fire Saga.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 286: BAN TOWN!
description: In an extra-long episode, we cover how many social media platforms are finally bringing down the banhammer; meanwhile, Apple keeps stepping in it with developers, most recently with changes to Apple Arcade. Then we bring on a special guest to talk about the most important story of the day: ridiculous YouTube drama.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 285: Farewell, Mac Apps
description: It's time for WWDC news!! But first, an update on the saga of Hey and the App Store. Don't worry, we have plenty to say about ARM-based Mac chips and the new MacOS.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 284: Hey hey hey
description: David Heinemeier Hansson joins us to discuss Basecamp's new email app Hey, their rejection from the App Store over in-app purchases, and the EU's antitrust case against Apple.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 283: Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone
description: The potential future of ARM Macs, the potential future of 230, and the past of CrossFit.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 282: An Episode of Rocket
description: This week we're covering Twitter and Facebook's respective responses to Trump's posts on their platforms, as well as recommending ways to contribute if you feel helpless right now but want to do something to support justice and Black Lives Matter.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 281: We Hacked A Switch
description: Oops! Let's dig into the WSJ report on Facebook's divisiveness. Then we revisit the magical days of hackable graphing calculators, and discuss the state of HBO Max, whatever that is. Finally, Christina hacked her Switch. BUT WHY!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 280: Cycle of Discourse
description: Microsoft's Fluid Functionality was the talk of the town at Build this week ‚Äî so let's talk about it! Then some bite-sized features on an upcoming change to Twitter replies and the iOS 13.5 update which will make it easier to open your phone without a mask. Finally: The Snyder Cut!??!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 279: New Guts
description: Let's talk new Surface hardware, and Epic's Unreal 5 demo! Then, an interview with Dan Moren about his new book, The Aleph Extraction. Finally, Tony Hawk is coming to this-gen consoles.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 278: 14 Cores
description: This week on Rocket we give you an update on Brianna's choice of Mac, and eulogize the butterfly keyboard, now confirmed dead with the announcement of the latest 13-inch Macbook Pro. Plus‚Ä¶ Fyre Festival is back??
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 277: Powerful Macs // Wu-View
description: An announcement, a REFERENDUM on which Mac to buy, a feud, and Animal Crossing.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 276: Time Goes By
description: This week on Rocket we're reacting to initial reviews of the Magic Keyboard from Apple, and talking about Peloton's pivot to in-home programming, as well as HBO Max's delayed launch. Finally, a mid-season reaction to Westworld!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 275: Finally, Contact Tracing
description: It's finally time for us to tackle the massive topic of contact tracing and how it could help the efforts against COVID-19. But first, some updates on the Magic Keyboard and the iPhone SE! Then it's on to the launch of Quibi, and Finally‚Ä¶ Final Fantasy VII!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 274: WeWork Continues
description: We've got another special guest this week: Rene Ritchie, who has just left iMore after a long tenure to fly solo with his own YouTube channel! But first, another installment of the WeWork saga, the Stalk Market, and then finally Resident Evil 3.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 273: Stonk Go Up
description: This week we're talking Tiger King with lawyer Carney Nasser, who had hand in bringing down Joe Exotic. But first, Zoom is back in the news ‚Äî not just as the main way people are stay connected right now, but for its security flaws too. Then, we're playing the Stalk Market ‚Äî excuse me, the stonk market ‚Äî in Animal Crossing: New Horizons. Rocket!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 272: Excited but Slightly Disturbed
description: Let's talk about some fun stuff to keep you occupied! First up, iPad Pro refresh reviews are out, but where are the keyboards?? Then we spend a good amount of time discussing Animal Crossing: New Horizons, which is a wonderful gift in this trying time. Bri and Frank are experimenting with some 3D printing techniques that will give us data on the use of 3D printers to help the medical supply shortage in the United States. And finally, some recommendations for how to spend your time!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 271: A Normal Week
description: This week the gang gets together to discuss Sony's dry but informative PlayStation 5 presentation, PLUS some new gear from Apple! Refreshed iPad Pro, and a fancy new keyboard that, despite what Simone tells you, is not available for pre-order yet. Finally, let's talk about the premiere of Westworld season 3!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 270: Airphones
description: Well, Christina is traveling this week so say your goodbyes. We've got an update on Sonos headphones and how the kids in China are taking down their teachers' attempts to assign them homework. NEXT UP there are soooooo many leaks on 9to5Mac this week. They got into some iOS 14 code so we're talking about all those updates. Don't miss it!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 269: Spicy Stuff
description: This week we're discussing the impact of COVID19 on the world. Then, there are new Apple products out there, and rumors as well: a 14-inch Macbook Pro?? The Verge's Mac Pro review?? We simply must discuss. Then Simone gets to be sanctimonious for 15 minutes because Christina loves the Amazon Go grocery store. She also doesn't drink soda. It's Rocket.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 268: Phil Spencer, Listen to This
description: Christina and Simone join forces to argue for a rose gold Xbox Series X, and discuss Apple's ongoing antitrust issues with its app store. Then, a heartwarming story about a Game Boy loving-grandma, and a disastrous story of the fall of HQ.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 267: Lumps n' Bumps
description: This week a big company is adding TFA to their ridiculously unsafe product and guess what! Foldable phones still don't work! Christina and Simone are begging phone makers to improve because we want those folding phones, baby! But is there a new contender for coolest new phone idea on the horizon? Perhaps...
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 266: Dating with Bots
description: Today on the show we've got Laurie Segall, prolific tech journalist and founder of Dot Dot Dot Media! Can she teach Simone to be less negative about tech? Then it's an update on our favorite memory of 2017, the Equifax hack. Finally, GO SEE BIRDS OF PREY!!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 265: Apps are Ruining America
description: With Christina's whereabouts unknown, we tackle the bad bad app that the Democratic Party decided to inflict on Iowa's caucus. Then we dig into the much-despised remake of Warcraft 3 and a little ol' problem with Google Photos and your private videos. Finally: Look at this train!! It's Rocket, baby.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 264: Subscribe to Save Christina
description: We've got some fun rumors about Apple and Samsung this week! Phones, tags, wireless charging, finally?? Tune in to hear all about it, including the most exciting rumor from Samsung that we have ever heard. Last up, Bri and Simone do a breakdown on Simone's latest video, which is about foley and sound design.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 263: The Bath Twice
description: Should Apple have followed through with plans to implement end-to-end encryption for iCloud back-ups? We'll talk about that and Sonos' plans to stop updating older devices on this week's episodes. Plus, Netflix's The Witcher is good, actually.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 262: The Gang Scams CES
description: This week we're ‚Ä¶ TALKING ABOUT IMPORTANT TECH NEWS, haha, like we do every week! So many big stories! There's gotta be a new iPhone out there, right? ‚Ä¶ right?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 261: It's CES, Snitches!
description: It's the most wonderful week of the year, CES, when all the weird, horrible, wonderful tech products are paraded before us. Let's talk best and worst of show, and then let's have a CIVIL DISCUSSION ABOUT STAR WARS.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 260: Gospel of Simone
description: We‚Äôre reviewing the decade, baby!! Tune in for the best products and the best and worst
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 259: Catastrophe
description: This week on Rocket, Simone is deathly ill, so Bri and Christina talk about the latest Boeing CEO news, the New York Times‚Äôs scary new privacy investigation, the worst gadgets/companies of the decade, and the debacle/hellscape that is ‚ÄúCats.‚Äù
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 258: X is Banned
description: This is a tech-heavy week, with discussion of the new Xbox Series X and security on Amazon's Ring cameras, as well as a long retrospective about the trouble Boeing 737 production and what it could imply about the future of self-driving cars.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 257: Not Even Netflix
description: Christina and Simone tackle the new Mac Pro, and the extremely enjoyable Gadgets of the Decade lists that are coming out now! Finally, an even more important list: trash food of the decade.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 256: Reverse Rocket Rule
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin are leaving Alphabet to Sundar Pichai! Woah! Also, there are ‚Ä¶ iPhone rumors! As usual. Finally, after 84 years, Marvel has released a Black Widow Trailer.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 255: Agents of Chaos
description: Description: Christina is back!! Let‚Äôs do a Christina catch-up: What did she think about the MacBook Pro and Pokemon Sword/Shield? Then it‚Äôs onto the real show, and we‚Äôre talking about Tesla‚Äôs angular new Cybertruck and Google Stadia. There was going to be another topic but instead we talked about Pokemon for thirty minutes. Who saw that coming?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 254: We're Cancelling Black Friday
description: Bri and Simone convene to discuss the new MacBook Pro model (old keyboard!) and some Black Friday deals that in the end‚Ä¶ all kind of suck. Does Black Friday suck? Finally, the new Pokemon game is here and boy has it been a lightning rod for controversy! Let's get heated.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 253: Hard Times for Tik Tok
description: Jeremy Kaplowitz and Matt Saincome from Hard Drive are joining Bri and Simone on this week's Rocket to chat about their new book, Apple's plot to release AR glasses and a headset, TikTok's trouble with the U.S. government, and the Sonic redesign.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 252: Retraction
description: Christina and Brianna are eating crow regarding the Morning Show and Apple TV Plus's programming. Simone is still a hold-out. Next, we're talking about lasers, the new way your home tech can be used to make you feel unsafe. And finally it's a mini scamtown on AirBnB, which frankly, needs to do better.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 251: Neutral Bud Hotel
description: Before Christina leaves on Microsoft Ignite, we're talking about the battle of the buds! Amazon's low-priced noise reducing echo buds versus Apple AirPods Pro. Then, the first impressions of Apple TV Plus are coming in, and it's looking boring out there. Finally, a brief chat about narrative games after the success of Outer Worlds.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 250: A Colossal Flip-Up
description: This week we're taking on WeWork and the intriguing money shuffling situation that's happening! Billions of dollars!!! Next up, Photoshop is coming to iPad, but what's it missing? And finally there's a new Star Wars trailer so you know we have to talk about it.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 249: Do Your Worst
description: Simone the traitor is back from Canada to discuss Google's Pixel event with Christina and Brianna, who have never done anything wrong in their lives. We've got opinions on the Pixelbook Go, Pixel 4 and 4XL, and of course Google Nest updates. Next, it's an official Rocket iPhone 11 review from Brianna and Simone! Finally, the $200 device that will play all your old GameBoy cartridges. It's Rocket, baby!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 248: Reverse Porn
description: Simone is in Canada, so Bri and Christina spend way too much time nerding out over the Microsoft Surface event, the drama happening with Blizzard and Hong Kong, and dissecting the Joker.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 247: A Big Whoopsy
description: First, an update on Simone's iPhone! Or‚Ä¶ is it Simone's iPhone? Next we've got updates on iOS13's less-than-stellar launch, and Mark Zuckerberg's leaked Facebook Q&A. Oh yeah, and Brianna is being sued by Alex Jones.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 246: Gateway Smart Speaker
description: With a host of new Amazon products, and some updates to Oculus Quest, surely we won't have time to talk about Apple stuff this week! Right?
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 245: To Upgrade or Not to Upgrade
description: It's iPHONE REVIEW WEEK here on Rocket! Who's upgrading? Who's staying behind? Find out here and only here. Next, the Sega Genesis Mini is coming out and miracle of miracles, it looks‚Ä¶ good? Did Sega make a good hardware product again? Last of all, a few words on MoviePass, may it rest in pieces.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 244: #christinashaming
description: Simone is back from marathon rehearsals to talk about this MARATHON APPLE EVENT! Iphones, iPads, subscription services‚Ä¶ it's all here! And it's all fine! Next, it's a 20-year retrospective on the Dreamcast from resident olds, Brianna and Christina. And finally, the second part of our interview with Rachel Williams, author of My Friend Anna.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 243: Anna Delvey is Not Our Friend
description: In tech news, Android 10 is out and we have thoughts. Next week is Apple‚Äôs big iPhone event, and we go over the rumors -- both new and outstanding -- and give our take on what we‚Äôll see. And smack in the middle of the show, we have the first part of our two-part interview with Rachel DeLoache Willliams, author of ‚ÄúMy Friend Anna‚Äù and former friend/victim of Rocket patron saint Anna Delvey. Suffice to say, Anna Delvey is no longer our friend.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 242: Disney Owns Our Culture
description: We're taking a Disney detour for most of the show this week, covering the streaming and park news out of D23. Then we discuss what to expect from Apple's September event: new iPhones, and a Macbook refresh that hopefully won't cost as much as a night in the Star Wars hotel!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 241: Rose Gold Collection
description: This is the dawning of the Age of Apple Services, and we finally have a price point for Apple Arcade! But is it appealing enough? Next, WeWork has filed an IPO and it's BANANAS. Let's dig in. Finally, those rascals at Snap are at it again, with the third round of Spectacles!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 240: MoviePass II: The Return
description: The Galaxy Note 10 and 10 Plus phones are here and they are huge. And even though Simone isn‚Äôt here, we still have to discuss the latest blockbuster reporting in the MoviePass scam. Viva MoviePass! Finally, Brianna and Christina interview attorney and author Carrie Goldberg whose new book, ‚ÄúNobody‚Äôs Victim‚Äù is in stores now.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 239: JUNK FOOD
description: It's the first anniversary of TikTok, and finally time for us to stop being late on it! Let's talk about what makes this video app distinct from Vine and Musical.ly. Next, 8Chan has been taken offline (for now) in the wake of the shooting in El Paso. Here's how that happened. Finally, a hard segue into talking about donuts.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 238: Uncool Hacks
description: Simone and Christina tuck into a hearty meal of Apple earnings, and this week's Capital One hack. Raise your hand if you're affected! Finally our beloved hosts talk their way into a third topic, and it's William Shatner's reactions to Outlander shipping, which really comes out of left field.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 237: A First!
description: Today we discuss the Joy-Con drift issues that have increasingly become an issue with the Nintendo Switch, and Simone eats crow. Then, it's ‚Ä¶ APPLE RUMOR KLAXON TIME! We're still workshopping the sound effects on that one. But what about those rumored new iPhones, eh? Then, it's all the trailers Simone didn't watch at Comic-Con. Sorry, guys.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 236: We're Riled Up
description: FaceApp is back and (maybe) sending your photos to spies, Zoom stepped in it, and the myth of the 10x Engineer.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 235: Farewell, MacBook
description: Apple has killed off the 12-inch MacBook, may it rest in peace. Meanwhile, Nintendo has introduced a new baby Switch for babies, called the Switch Lite! Finally, the new Charlie's Angels movie looks rad as hell.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 234: What Did We Say About Rocket Rules
description: Rocket rules apply, both to Jony Ive leaving Apple, and Simone being at San Diego Comic-Con! Also, we discuss Vice's article about Google Jigsaw's troubled inner workings, and the latest drama between Taylor Swift and Scooter Braun.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 233: Apple Rumor Klaxon
description: On this episode of Rocket you'll be able to beta test our new Apple Rumor klaxon (patented). Yep, we're talking about the ARM-based Mac rumors! Next up, there's a new Raspberry Pi model out there and everyone is excited. Lastly, what would 2019 be without another grim workplace story? This week it's Jason Schreier's report on the QA team with Treyarch.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 232: Centralizing Decentralized Currency
description: Simone is back, just in time to discuss Facebook's new cryptocurrency, Libra, and its implications for the global financial system. Yay! Then, a cute refresh on PowerPoint and Excel. FInally, the Spice Girl drama that was laid to rest after 20 years.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 231: The Planet is on Fire
description: It‚Äôs summer in the northern hemisphere, so we wanted to talk about stuff we like and not stuff that makes us angry. This week, Bri and Christina cover E3 2019 -- and they don‚Äôt even get into all the news, there was just that much of it. They also talk about the spate of amazing summer TV on the air right now and finally, discuss the current career renaissance of Keanu Reeves.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 230: Buy Christina a Mac Pro
description: This week, Bri and Christina cover WWDC, which includes the new Mac Pro, iOS 13, iPad OS, SwiftUI and more. YouTube did bad things but rather than talk about that, we focused on the finer things in life, like Xbox‚Äôs new body spray.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 229: Infrastructure Weak
description: This week! An update on Huawei, and more depressing news out of Facebook as a manipulated video of Nancy Pelosi sparks content and conversation. Next, a tiny yellow handheld called Playdate is getting tech-lovers hyped up! And finally, we would've talked about Pokemon Sleep‚Ä¶ if reviews of the Millenium Falcon ride at Disneyland Galaxy's Edge hadn't dropped.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 228: Piece of Dust
description: Big, bad news for Huawei this week, as multiple companies cut ties with them. But is it the right thing to do? Next, Apple promises improved keyboards, but Brianna is (rightfully) still wary. Finally, the Oculus Quest is freakin' awesome and there's no reason not to buy one if you want untethered VR.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 227: Hot Terminal
description: Christina and Simone discuss last week's Microsoft Build. Then, the Apple v. Pepper lawsuit has moved into the next stage‚Ä¶ what'll happen? A new vulnerability in Intel chips has been discovered and fixed. And finally, it wouldn't be a Simone and Christina show without some YouTuber drama.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 226: Oppression Team
description: Brianna and Simone tackle Facebook's developer conference, F8, as well as Google I/O. Last up, Bri promotes the latest and greatest Kickstarter scam.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 225: I've Got A Dog Clicker
description: The future promises quantum computing and vertical TVs, but do they matter? Then Anna Delvey and T-Pain.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 224: Conspiracy Entrepreneurs
description: The Rocket Rule is not a conspiracy. This week we discuss Samsung's FOLD FIASCO, which happened a few days after we recorded Rocket last week, sad face. Then Anna Merlan, author of Republic of Lies, joins us to talk about conspiracy theories and their rise in popularity! Finally, it's the Game Boy's 30th Anniversary. We're old!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 223: Aunt Becky is Going to Jail
description: This week, Simone is off in LA being fabulous, so Bri and Christina take over the show. After some quick follow-up to last week‚Äôs show, Christina and Bri discuss the early responses to the upcoming Samsung Galaxy Fold. Surprisingly, reviewer‚Äôs don‚Äôt hate it. Christina still says she‚Äôs not buying one. She‚Äôs probably lying. Then, they tackle the highs and lows of science. The high: we got an image of a black hole! The low: one of the scientists on the team that achieved this feat was harassed off the internet. Because the internet. Bri and Christina then segue to talk about rumors of a Microsoft Surface AirPods competitor, and chat about how they use AirPods and wireless earbuds in general. And finally, two of our favorite crooked celebrities, Lori Loughlin (Aunt Becky) and Allison Mack are back in the news and totally going to jail.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 222: The Cursed Episode
description: This week Christina joins Simone in New York for a boatload of technical problems (more than you even know), but also a discussion about Australia's legislation to criminalize social media platform owners for violent video content. Then Brianna interviews fellow Relay member Dan Moren about his new book, The Bayern Agenda! Finally, Christina has been reading Ladies Who Punch, a tell-all book about The View, and we're rehashing the Barbara Walters vs. Elisabeth Hasselbeck fight like ten years later.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 221: Janties!
description: DO YOU KNOW THE GOSPEL OF JANTIES? Well, you will. Then we're covering Jason Schreier's barn-burner of a story on Bioware's flawed Anthem development. Next up, details about the Apple Card have been dissected on TechCrunch and some hosts may have changed their opinions. Finally, does the HBO documentary on Theranos measure up against the stiff competition of Bad Blood by John Carreyrou and The Dropout by Rebecca Jarvis? Find out!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 220: She's in Dubai
description: Nothing will stop Christina from talking about the Apple Event, not even an 8-hour time difference and the Atlantic Ocean. We cover Apple's credit card, Apple News+, the new Apple TV ideas and also Apple Arcade. Next, what is Europe doing with its internet laws? Ridiculous things. Finally, the Spice Girls are back in the news for the best reason possible.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 219: Banjo Is Free
description: All the GDC and Apple news is hitting hard this week! There are new iPads, new AirPods, and Stadia, Google's new streaming service! Bri is at GDC and she has her eye on some upcoming games. Lastly, Netflix is in the news for cancelling beloved sitcom One Day At A Time.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 218: Side Door
description: What a busy and marvelous week. Senator Warren made a policy proposal on Medium to break up companies that, like Amazon and Apple, make over 25 billion dollars and sell apps on platforms they control. You know we have things to say about that. Next, a review of Samsung's smaller phone, the S10E. And finally, the college scam you've all been waiting for.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 217: Rogue One Two
description: Brianna and Simone GO ROGUE. We're talking about the general state of living games ‚Äî games that provide their publishers with revenue until the next big thing comes out. Then, Brianna chats with genuine futurist Amy Webb about her new book and the AI of the future. Finally, YouTube tackles, not for the first time, its problems with child exploitation.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 216: We're Not Buying Them
description: This week the show is a bad sandwich. First up, awesome tech news: Huawei and Samsung's foldable phones, and the Hololens 2! Next, the rotten meat that is Facebook's content moderation working conditions. But then we have an update on The Life of Elizabeth Holmes from Vanity Fair. Everything's coming up Rocket!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 215: Oculus Rift Tea Time
description: Special guest Blake J. Harris joins us this episode. Blake is the author of The History of the Future: Oculus, Facebook, and the Revolution That Swept Virtual Reality, out now from HarperCollins. Tune in to learn what our SECRET SEGMENT is! Lastly, Samsung has finally revealed the Fold, their $1,980 foldable phone.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 214: The 24th Time Zone
description: Christina is in AUSTRALIA for Microsoft Ignite! Meanwhile, Jeff Bezos is all over the news and it's time for a serious discussion of cybersecurity and nudes. Next up, Apple's proposed Apple News paid tier seems like a bum deal for publishers! Lastly, it's the 20th Anniversary of Final Fantasy 8, a game that maybe isn't as bad as it's supposed to be.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 213: Our Favorite Things
description: Rebecca Jarvis joins our hosts to go in-depth on Theranos and Elizabeth Holmes. She's the resident expert, producing and hosting the podcast The Dropout for ABC. We also talk about Angela Ahrendt's legacy at Apple, as Deirdre O'Brien takes over a SVP of Retail + People. Then, the SS7 exploits that have allowed hackers to drain bank accounts in Europe. Finally Christina, Brianna, and Simone also discuss the massive media layoffs that hit this month.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 212: Tiny Screws
description: Jeff Hwang rejoins us to discuss Apple's troubling week. A FaceTime bug allows users to eavesdrop in group calls, and a New York Times report details the company's difficulties manufacturing the Mac Pro on American soil. Finally, the Resident Evil 2 remake is OUT and Bri is LOVING IT.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 211: Suckville 9 to 5
description: Bri has finally tried the iPad Pro for herself, and she has thoughts! Next up, Xiaomi has shown off their foldable phone prototype, which begs the question ‚Äî why? Nest is in the headlines again, and again, the news isn't good. Finally, we've all had a chance to watch both Fyre Festival documentaries. Find out what we think!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 210: Foldable Phone Future
description: The gang is back with a quick update on Tesla and electric cars, and the sexiest tech news of the year. Next, a discussion on patent law and the FTC's suit against Qualcomm. And last but not least, there are not one, but two Fyre Festival documentaries, proving that the world might actually be okay.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 209: Pepsi is Not a Sponsor of This Podcast
description: Friend of the pod Jeff Hwang is back to talk with Brianna and Christina about some of the best -- and worst -- products from CES 2019, including some surprising Apple news and a very frustrating controversy. Later, the gang discusses a new report into how easy it is for people to track your phone‚Äôs location and Kendall Jenner‚Äôs very brave secret.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 208: Stop Drocks
description: The predictions are true ‚Äî Apple is lowering its revenue projections due to low iPhone demand. Plus, Tesla's stocks are dropping too. It's Stockmageddon! Next, an update on pornographic deepfakes, and Assassin's Creed Odyssey. Not together.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 207: The 19th Year of 2018
description: The Rocket Awards for 2018 have arrived.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 206: That's a Win!
description: Christina is back from her world tour! On today's show we discuss the iPhone XR's lack of popularity, YouTube's dangerous algorithms, and a plethora of desserts including Taylor Swift's use of facial recognition (a very Rocket topic), and more!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 205: Epic Games, Cars, and Adult Content
description: Simone and Bri are joined by Jeff Hwang to discuss Epic pulls the Infinity Blade series from the iOS store, Audi giving a test-drive of their electric e-tron SUV in Abu Dhabi, and how Tumblr's adult content ban is going.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 204: Great Chicken Caper of 2018
description: Facebook is back in the news after the UK Parliament releases 250 pages of documents about how the company handles data! Next, Microsoft is reportedly considering scrapping Edge and building a browser based in Chromium. Finally, a triple-dessert! She-Ra is a good show, Laura Loomer chained herself to Twitter, and the PlayStation Classic sucks.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 203: Don't Catfish
description: The Supreme Court will next year decide whether consumers can sue Apple under antitrust laws, and we're discussing the case in-depth. Next, the PS Classic reviews are out, and they're not great, Bob! Finally, the creepy case of an Instagram copycat.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 202: Christina's Makes a Good Buying Decision
description: Simone is out sick this week, but that doesn‚Äôt mean Bri and Christina can‚Äôt talk at length about the blockbuster story about Facebook in the New York Times, and what it means for all of us. Brianna also tells us about a hilarious tech snafu in the Tesla forums, and Bri and Christina share what they are doing for Thanksgiving and why Christina (finally!) bought a PS4.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 201: Christina's Wallet Strikes Back
description: Amazon has settled on New York City as one of its next headquarters, and we have feelings. Also, Christina finally has hands-on impressions of the new iPad Pro. Last but most importantly, the Detective Pikachu trailer is out and it's so‚Ä¶ so much.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 200: Two Hundred!
description: It's episode 200! Join Bri, Christina and Simone as they assess the MacBook Air and iPad Pro reviews, discuss Simone's HANDS-ON experience with Magic Leap, and follow up on what happened with TanaCon. Plus, Bri talks to Motorola about their new 5G phones.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 199: 34.8 Billion Dollars
description: It's another APPLE EVENT WEEK! Time to talk about the MacBook Air, the iPad Pro (thanks for the new Pencil, Tim!), and the Mac Mini. That's the meat of the episode, but the bread of our Rocket sandwich is IBM's purchase of Red Hat and the PlayStation Classic's game lineup.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 198: An Influencer Who Works for Microsoft
description: After departures from Instagram and Whatsapp, Oculus is the next Facebook property to lose a high-level employee. IPhone XR reviews are also out! What's the verdict? Finally, Simone's Hell Week is here, with Red Dead Redemption 2 coming out and Fallout 76 in beta.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 197: The Magic of Necromancy
description: We discuss the Magic Leap Con, Facebook's new Portal speaker, and the resurrection of Palm and Winamp. Plus, Dyson's miraculous new Air Wrap.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 196: The Big Hack Breakdown: Supermicro, Apples Watches, and Google Pixel 3
description: It's time to breakdown Bloomberg's allegations about Supermicro in this mega-show. Then, Apple Watch 4 reviews and Google's Pixel 3 event. Facebook also wants to put a camera in your home!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 195: Summer Never Ends
description: It's a Surface-tastic week. Microsoft's latest event, plus finally Brianna and Christina's reviews of the Surface Go. Then Simone reviews Assassin's Creed Odyssey, and there's a very important update on MOVIEPASSOCALYPSE.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 194: iPhone Hypocrisy
description: Brianna breaks a promise to America and buys an iPhone. Then, Wal-Mart's enforcement of the lettuce blockchain. Is it good ‚Äî or silly? Marvel's Spider-Man is out and Bri's twenty hours in. Finally, the finale of Fyre Festival.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 193: A Masochist and a Liar
description: It's new Apple hardware week, and reviews are out! iOS 12 is here as well, and Playstation has cooked up something new.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 192: Are the New iPhones Worth it?
description: Brianna returns just in time for Apple's lackluster September event. That said, your hosts still spend close to an hour talking about the new iPhones, and the Apple Watch. Then Brianna talks about the lessons she learned from running her first campaign for Congress. Later, Simone previews the first 7 hours of Assassin's Creed Odyssey.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 191: Summer of Scams: The Finale
description: Jack Dorsey and Sheryl Sandberg take on Congress in this week's hearings, but to what end? Next, Apple's biggest leak yet reveals the form factor of two of its new phones. Finally, an update on Theranos and Elizabeth Holmes, a story we've followed since day one ‚Äî and it's not quite over yet.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 190: Wrestling is the Fake Sport
description: Three new iPhones are on the way to Apple's September event, and Apple is sending out more feelings into the AR world. We discuss new tech, Trump's fight with the very algorithms that brought him the presidency, and Logan Paul's fight with KSI on this week's Rocket! Plus: an update on Elon Musk's romantic life.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 189: Poo Show At The Frick Factory
description: Nvidia has new GPUs! Rumors of the Mac mini are happening! Azealia Banks is still doing things! This is a lot of exclamation marks!
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 188: Tech Jealousy
description: Galaxy Note 9 reviews are in! Longer battery life, and a thousand-dollar price tag. Next, big spender Christina Warren made two purchases this week: the Nokia 81140 4G, and the Microsoft Surface Go! Finally, the most Rocket-worthy topic of all time: Azealia Banks' Instagram Story expose on Elon Musk and Grimes.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 187: Simone is the Mayonaise
description: In this super-sized episode, Bri and Christina talk about all the tech news they can -- and still didn‚Äôt cover everything that happened this week. First up, Magic Leap reviews are out, was it worth the hype? Then the Sarah Jeong harassment controversy is discussed (and Christina‚Äôs inadvertent involvement). In happier news, MoviePass has changed business models. Again. (Christina got her merch!) A private Tesla? What is Elon tweeting? Finally, we end with a secret segment part two.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 186: Inauthentic Activity
description: Heyo, it's time to talk about legislating 3D printed guns. Is it worth it? Then Facebook re-enters the spotlight with the news that it has deactivated a whopping 32 political pot-stirring accounts. MoviePass is on its last legs ‚Äî when will it fall, and how much merch will Christina Warren get out of it? You have all the answers here.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 185: Thin and Light
description: This time we're ready for MacBook Pro news: we discuss Apple's massive thermal throttling but and how we got here. Then, Christina takes a break so that Bri and Simone can bandy about rumors on Microsoft's new game-streaming console. Close the show out with a discussion of James Gunn's firing from Disney after a right-wing campaign.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 184: Stealth MacBook Refresh
description: In Rocket tradition, new MacBook Pro news dropped as soon as we were done recording last week! But this week we dig into the new specs. Then join us on a journey through scams ‚Äî Christina is still on the MoviePass ride, but when will it end? And a video game Kickstarter was deemed not responsible for refunding over $4,000 from a customer, even after it failed to deliver the goods for years. Finally, why you should watch Glow season 2.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 183: It Could Look Worse
description: The App Store is 10 years old! What's the most embarrassing app you've ever downloaded? Also in the news, Magic Leap's first demo, and the company's partnership with AT&T. But ... why? We also discuss Microsoft's new Surface Go and why the Nintendo Switch is the best console ever.
author: Christina Warren, Brianna Wu, and Simone De Rochefort

title: 182: Nap Queen
description: ALL the rumors about the new iPhones, analyzed, debunked, and more. Plus, Samsung is (potentially) at it again with a glitch that will send your nudes to random contacts. Then Christina, Brianna, and Simone discuss TanaCon, enthusiastically and at length.
